title: GLAP: General contrastive audio-text pretraining across domains and languages
author: Heinrich Dinkel (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Zhiyong Yan (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Tianzi Wang (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Yongqing Wang (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Xingwei Sun (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Yadong Niu (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Jizhong Liu (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Gang Li (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Junbo Zhang (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Jian Luan (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.)
relevance_why: GLAP extends contrastive learning methodologies to multilingual and multimodal contexts, which aligns with my work on audio-language modeling and could inform my approach to text-to-audio generation.
background: Developing a model that links audio data and textual descriptions in multiple languages and across various domains, improving retrieval tasks and speech understanding.
contribution: GLAP introduces a unified encoder framework that enhances contrastive language-audio pretraining to effectively handle sound, music, and speech across multiple languages and domains, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like Contrastive Language-Audio Pretraining (CLAP) typically focused on sound and music, often neglecting speech understanding.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates speech data into the training framework of CLAP without sacrificing performance on music and sound retrieval, leading to improved multilingual capabilities.

key_innovation: Utilizes a single general audio encoder that maintains high performance across diverse audio types, leveraging a novel training objective that enhances learning.
real_world_impact: Promotes more effective audio-text retrieval systems that are applicable in real-world multilingual environments, enhancing accessibility and usability in applications like automatic captioning and audio-based search.
limitations: The authors do not discuss specific limitations in the paper.

new_terms.contrastive learning: **Contrastive learning** is a technique in machine learning where the model is trained to differentiate between similar and dissimilar pairs of data points, enhancing representation learning.
new_terms.multimodal: **Multimodal** refers to systems or models that can process and integrate multiple types of data, such as audio and text.

open_sourcing: The source code and checkpoints are publicly available.
